catalog_info.title: Feuding and Peacemaking in Viking Age Iceland (c.870 to c.1150 C.E)
catalog_info.prereq: Course open to Freshman Students Only
catalog_info.description: Close readings of Icelandic family sagas, along with poems, historical narratives, and a law code, provide an interdisciplinary approach to Viking Age Iceland (c.870 to c.1150 C.E.), where a complex legal and political order was maintained in the absence of a state or public officials to enforce the law.
